content: हंसः [हस्-अच्-पृषो° वर्णागमः] (said to be derived from हस्; <ab>cf.</ab> भवेद्वर्णागमाद् हंसः <ls>Sk.</ls>) {@--1@} A swan, goose, duck, flamingo; हंसाः संप्रति पांडवा इव वनादज्ञातचर्यां गताः <ls>Mk. 5. 6</ls>; न शोभते सभामध्ये हंसमध्ये बको यथा <ls>Subhāṣ.</ls>, <ls>R. 17. 25.</ls> (the description of this bird, as given by Sanskrit writers, is more poetical than real; he is described as forming the vehicle of the god Brahman, and as ready to fly towards the Mānasa lake at the approach of rains; <ab>cf.</ab> मानस. According to a very general poetical convention he is represented as being gifted with the peculiar power of separating milk from water; {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} सारं ततो ग्राह्यमपास्य फल्गु हंसो यथा क्षीरमिवांबुमध्यात् <ls>Pt. 1</ls>; हंसो हि क्षीरमादत्ते तन्मिश्रा वर्जयत्यपः <ls>Ś. 6. 27</ls>; नीरक्षीरविवेके हंसालस्यं त्वमेव तनुषे चेत् . विश्वस्मिन्नधुनान्यः कुलव्रतं पालयिष्यति कः <ls>Bv. 1. 13</ls>; see <ls>Bh. 2. 18</ls> also). {@--2@} The Supreme Soul, Brahman. {@--3@} The individual soul, (जीवात्मन्). {@--4@} One of the vital airs. {@--5@} The sun. {@--6@} Śiva. {@--7@} Viṣṇu. {@--8@} Kāmadeva. {@--9@} An unambitious monarch. {@--10@} An ascetic of a particular order. {@--11@} A spiritual preceptor. {@--12@} One free from malice, a pure person. {@--13@} A mountain. {@--14@} Envy, malice. {@--15@} A buffalo. --सौ ({%<ab>m.</ab>%} <ab>pl.</ab>). <ab>N.</ab> of a tribe said to live in the Plakṣa-Dvīpa.
